description: Viewing movies on a Plex server through a browser not the best solution as the server will have to transcode just about everything. Enter the Plex Media Player which takes the load off your server by enabling passthrough. I hit one or two glitches but for the most part it runs well.
Just a plex media server with changed name to media player and running in isolated window
This is a fantastic Plex Media Player that mirrors all the other Plex clients on Windows, Mac, Android etc. Brings Linux up to par and had no issues at all.

I just install it the app, as a Flatpack work very well.
Connecting over the internet to my home server, the playback is very fast.
Much better then the Web client.
While this works better than the AppImage in the fact that the UI actually loads and I can log in, I can't play any media and just get Playback errors on openSUSE tumbleweed :/
It can't even connect to my Plex Media Server! Useless.
